intro: Gouldia terminalis f. makawaoensis, commonly known as the Makawao gouldia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, characterized by its grass-like appearance and rhizomatous growth habit. The plant features slender, erect stems with narrow, grass-like leaves that are often tinged with red or purple at the base. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in rocky or streamside habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
